intro: Solanum carolinense f. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower nightshade, is a variant of the common nightshade plant. It is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. The plant features showy white flowers that bloom in the summer, distinguishing it from the typical purple-flowered form. Its leaves are typically oval and slightly hairy, with a distinctive scent when crushed. The fruit is a small, green berry that turns red when ripe, containing toxic alkaloids.
